result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco M. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marco M. Edwards is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marco M. Edwards was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Marco M. Edwards was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $300.00 & $250 on Ct 3 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges (each count)
**Pay restitution plus surcharges from file 13-CF-565.  May Not have contact with Valinda T, her residence or place of employment.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:45pm-  Matter heard with 13CF565 & 14CF252.   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions on each count concurrent.  31 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $300.00 fine on count 1 & $250.00 fine on count 3 plus costs & DNA surcharge. Restitution in 13CF565 is to be paid during the term of this probation.  Appeal rights given.  Bond in this case is to be applied to the restitution order in 13CF565.

3/31/2015 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 4/27/2015 at 2:30pm.  Attorney Ekes did not receive his copy of the PSI until this morning as P&P sent it to the courts - not to the attorney directly.  Parties notified in court.
to DE.   Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.

Motion and Order for Lien on Bond for 14CF307 and 13PA475PJ. A lien shall be placed on the bond in 14CF307 and the bond money in the amount of $1,330.00 shall be forfeited entirely to the DE/RE's arrears obligation in 13PA475PJ.
**03-09-15, amount corrected - NSJ
the remaining bond monies, after costs have been paid in 14CF307, totaling the sum of $1,330.00 shall be applied to Kenosha file 13PA475 for the DE's child support arrears obligations
03-04-15 Hearing removed from the court's calendar - no longer needed.
from Atty Ekes regarding DE's cooperation with the PSI

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:35am-  Matter heard with 13CF565 & 14CF252.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the court. Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Public defender's office states they did not receive notification until 7/30/2014.  Court adjourns matter to September 19, 2014 at 08:45 am.  Bond continued.
